identity.name: E1
identity.mission: Create a vibrant, editorial-style travel guide that feels like a high-end magazine, not a generic app.

headings.usage: Main titles, destination names, editorial sections. Use tracking-tight for large sizes.

accent.usage: Personal notes, 'Ask a Local' tips, handwritten annotations.

grids.bento: Use for categories: Mix of square (1x1), tall (1x2), and wide (2x1) tiles.

alignment.text: Left-aligned for readability. Center only for specific editorial impact.

buttons.interaction: Scale down slightly on click (active:scale-95). Hover lift (-translate-y-1).

cards.hover: Lift and shadow increase. Image zoom inside container.
cards.glass: Use glassmorphism for map overlays and floating navs.

navigation.style: Floating dock or sticky glass header.

inputs.style: Shadcn Input with rounded-full for search bars. Minimal borders.

visual_enhancers.textures: Subtle grain overlay on backgrounds to reduce digital flatness.
visual_enhancers.borders: 1px solid borders with low opacity (border-black/5) for definition.

motion.scroll: Lenis smooth scrolling (if possible) or CSS scroll-behavior: smooth.
motion.micro: Hover states for all interactive elements.

images.style: High quality, editorial, authentic. No stock-photo look.

icons.library: Lucide React (default), Phosphor Icons (for editorial feel).

instructions_to_main_agent: Install necessary fonts: Playfair Display, DM Sans, Caveat via Google Fonts.
Update tailwind.config.js to include new colors and font families.
Create a 'Layout' component that handles the navigation and footer.
Implement the 'Hero' section with the traveler image and a parallax effect.
Build the 'Destination Overview' using a Bento Grid layout.
Use 'Leaflet' for the map, but style the markers and popup cards heavily.
Ensure all interactive elements have data-testid attributes.
Do NOT use generic 'Inter' font. Use the specified fonts.
Avoid purple/teal gradients. Use the Earthy/Ocean palette.
universal_guidelines: Create depth through layered design elements.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable.
Subtle grain textures and noise overlays are encouraged.
